display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

li.font: Web users interact with the Mastodon application backend component (uses the Ruby on Rails framework). They create profiles, read or write posts, follow other users, etc.
PostgreSQL is the main storage for user posts, profiles, etc. This is the source of truth for the whole system.

Redis is the main caching mechanism for feeds. Feeds are pushed by the streaming backend component, or coming from other Mastodon instances (or Mastodons) from the federated network. It is also used for posting Sidekiq jobs. Caching is performed in system memory, thus all operations are usually very fast.

Sidekiq main role is to propagate data between Mastodon instances in the federated network. This is the main component responsible with propagating user posts, thus making sure you receive updates from your followers and vice versa.
S3 storage is used for media file caching (video, images, etc).

h1.span: Each data flux is highlighted using a specific colour for better observability.

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
